text:
64M s/p fall from 10 ft ladder with 3d HA, dizziness, n/v, 3 witnessed
   LOC -> b/l SDH, OR delayed for R tension PTX, s/p CT [**12-8**], now s/p L
   crani/evac [**12-9**], s/p R crani/evac [**12-10**].
   Anxiety
   Assessment:
   Extremely anxious, agitated, resisting care at times.
   Action:
   Reassurance offered at all times-reoriented prn, Olanzapine x 1,
   Fentanyl continues at 150mcq. Hands remain restrained, Belt on when in
   chair
   Response:
   Agitated most of day until 1500, sleeping at present
   Plan:
   Monitor agitation, offer reassurance, reoriente prn, meds as per
   orders.
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   St 165 x2 self limiting, 110-130
s with agitation, 90-100 otherwise ,
   pac
s and isolated pvc
s noted,
   Action:
   Iv Lopressor x 1 , po Lopressor ^ to 125mg, neuro/[**Name8 (MD) 91**] md
s aware of
   st.
   Response:
   Little effect from iv Lopressor,  sr with decreased agitation
   Plan:
   Monitor hr and rythym, Lopressor as per orders.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Temp 102.4
   Action:
   Bc x 1, Tylenol 650 mg x 1
   Response:
   Temp 100.6, profuse diaphoresis
   Plan:
   Monitor comfort, temp, check cultures pending
   Subdural hemorrhage (SDH)
   Assessment:
   Perl, grasp strong and equal, will not follows commands consistently.
   Mae. Small amount of serosang drainage from distal part of incision.
   Staples remain intact.
   Action:
   Neuro vs q2-3 hr, unchanged. Ns to clean incision remains ota.
   Response:
   Scant drainage from head incision. Reoriented q2hours.
   Plan:
   Monitor neuro status as per orders q3hr, monitor incional drainage.
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   Remains intubated , on cpap 10/ips 10. mod amounts of thick yellow
   sputum. Bs course upper-diminished bibasilar.
   Action:
   Suctioned for small to moderate amounts of thick yellow sputum. Cpt x
   2. oob to chair tolerated fairly well.
   Response:
   Bs less course,
   Plan:
   Monitor respiratory status,
